subject: writing tests for network servers
msgSnippet: hello ppl ~ can someone point me to any dox out there on how to write tests for network servers? specifically i am looking to automate testing of server code
messageBody:
hello ppl ~

can someone point me to any dox out there on how to write tests for network
servers? specifically i am looking to automate testing of server code which
typically takes in two streams - an input/output stream ( usually from a
socket) and does i/o on it. i guess i am really looking for hints on how to
write tests for streams.

eg. here is a snippet of what the server code looks like:
public class Server
{
....
public void service( InputStream in, OutputStream out)
{
// this is the functionality i want to be able to test
}
}

one approach that i am considering is creating a Server object and the two
streams using ByteArray<Streams>, passing the streams to the service(..) method
.. then passing the streams onto a separate thread from the application thread
which does i/o the way a client typically would with the server by calling i/o
methods on the streams.

any ideas, pointers and hints appreciated! tia ~
